name: Wisconsin Division of Vocational Rehabilitation (DVR)
address: Multiple locations across Wisconsin. The main line is (608) 261-0050 or (800) 442-3477
description: DVR provides employment services, vocational counseling, assistive technology, and job placement assistance to people with disabilities to help them obtain, maintain, and advance employment. They also offer training and technical assistance to employers
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: Disability:IN Wisconsin
description: This is a statewide business network dedicated to disability inclusion. They provide resources, training, and networking opportunities for employers to foster inclusive workplaces
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: Think Ability Wisconsin
description: Think Ability Wisconsin provides information and resources to support individuals with disabilities in finding employment and assists employers in creating inclusive environments. They offer navigator services to connect people with resources
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: Employment Resources, Inc. (ERI)
description: ERI is a nonprofit organization dedicated to advancing employment opportunities for people with disabilities. They offer expertise and training to promote best employment practices and strategies
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: Pathways of Wisconsin, Inc.
description: This nonprofit helps adults with physical and developmental disabilities find competitive employment. They partner with employers to facilitate positive collaborations through supported employment and customized employment
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: Goodwill of South Central Wisconsin (Supported Employment Program)
address: Multiple locations. Contact for specific office
description: Their Supported Employment program assists adults with disabilities in finding and maintaining meaningful employment in the community, with job coaches providing support at no cost to employers
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: Aptiv
address: Various locations including Black River Falls, Janesville, La Crosse, Madison, Richland Center, Sparta, Tomah, Viroqua, WI
description: Aptiv provides supported employment services, including job coaching, for individuals with disabilities to help them maintain competitive employment. They serve teens and transition-age students
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: Regional Enterprises - Reach, Inc.
description: Reach, Inc. offers job placement programs that assist individuals with disabilities in achieving their employment goals. Their clients are employed in several Wisconsin counties
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: Wisconsin Board for People with Developmental Disabilities (Partners with Business Initiative)
description: This initiative aims to help businesses hire and support workers with disabilities by providing grants and technical assistance to service providers and employers to implement best practices in supported employment
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation

name: The Inclusive Bean
description: A woman-led non-profit coffee shop that prides itself on staffing individuals with disabilities, allowing them to thrive. While not solely a hiring support service, it exemplifies inclusive employment practices
services: Disabled-owned Hiring support in Wisconsin consultation
